intro: Linaria cossoniana, commonly known as the Cosson's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Linaria cossoniana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
